entries.title: How Wizards of the Coast became Dungeons & Dragons’ arch-villain
entries.description: The D&D Open Game License controversy, explained.

entries.title: Game developers think the metaverse is bogus, survey shows
entries.description: Game developers don't have much faith in the metaverse or blockchain technology, according to an annual survey.

entries.title: Political fundraising platform ActBlue names its first Black female CEO
entries.description: Regina Wallace-Jones, a former elected official and tech and finance executive, succeeds longtime leader Erin Hill at the helm of the liberal fundraising platform.

entries.title: Amazon is closing its charity, which donated millions, citing limited impact
entries.description: Amazon’s charity arm is shutting down next month amid broader job cuts at the company.

entries.title: It cost millions to join the Overwatch League. Teams are pushing for a break.
entries.description: Overwatch League teams are reportedly seeking financial assistance amid flagging revenue and viewership.

entries.title: He made a children’s book using AI. Then came the rage.
entries.description: Ammaar Reshi used AI to write and illustrate a children's book in a weekend. He became the center of a fiery debate: Are these tools a grim reaper for the arts?
